page.title: 14WESTBURY QUARRY
page.content: Westbury Quarry is located on the edge of the Mendip Plateau at a height of about 229 metres.The quarry is working deposits of{Carboniferous Limestone} and has a probable future of about 10 years.Blasting is limited by present planning regulations andthe present enphasis is on quarrying downwards to avoid scarring the sky line.The quarry depth is now about 50 metres.The present crushing equipment was installed in 1967 and an{asphalt {processing plant}exists at the quarry. Deliveries extend southwards asfaras Bournmouth but the quarry competes with others close by for markets to the North.The quarry employs 10 people and most stone is used for road construction,asphalt and concrete structures.The Quarry is a site of discoveries of cave bear and lion from the Pleistocene Ice Ages.
